subject: Education
title: Erikson's Eight Stages: Challenges for Life
description: One-minute skill: Erikson's Eight Stages: Challenges for Life.

hook.text: Erik Erikson said every stage of life has a crisis to resolve. Fail at one and it echoes through every stage after.

buildup.text: Eight stages from birth to death: trust vs. mistrust, autonomy vs. shame, initiative vs. guilt, and onward.

discovery.text: The school-age crisis is 'industry vs. inferiority.' Children must feel competent, or they develop lasting self-doubt.

twist.text: Erikson himself was a school dropout who never earned a degree. He understood developmental crises from personal

climax.text: Erikson showed that education isn't just academic â€” it's about resolving emotional challenges at each stage of growth.

punchline.text: Life is eight crises. School happens right in the middle of the hardest ones.
